intro: Phyllostegia makawaoensis, commonly known as the Makawao strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. This species is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as mesic forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
